column4: hi, I need help....My BIOS is not detecting hard disk, Windows is not detecting hard disk, Ubuntu is not detecting hard disk but disk utility in live mode is listing 'PATA Host Adapter' and 'Sata Host Adapter' but no options under them. What happened?
sounds like the drive died, BIOS not detecting the drive is bad
may need to open the system and check connectors (with the power OFF)
I pulled it out and replaced firmly...still
sounds like its dead, does it spin up?
is it PATA or SATA?
uhm I don't know...both? I think disk is spinning...should i remove disk guard and check?
those are the controllers on the motherboard
with no drives attached, they'd still show
I think hard disk is spinning...its warm and i can feel vibrations from it after touching it
could try a different cable if you have one
if its a PATA drive, mke sure it's set as master and on it's own controller to avoid complications with conflicting devices on the same channel
uhm cable?....there are two slots in which disk fits in laptop...there is no cable :(
oh, laptop makes it a bit trickier
try resetting BIOS to failsafe defaults
did it already
i'd say dead drive then
is there a utility to confrim it in Ubuntu?
you may be able to test it using the manufactrers tool on the ultimate boot cd
